Description: Red pottery platter, repaired from three pieces, with remains of a yellow-cream slip on the surface. Curved upwards at the edge to an angular rim. The height is slightly irregular. The coarse red siltware fabric contains many inclusions of grit.
Curator's comments: The use of a pale yellow-cream slip may indicate that this local product was attempting to imitate the appearance of imported mortaria.
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.99, p.189, pl.31, p.216, pl.58)
